info.title: ClarusWMS API
info.description:
REST API for ClarusWMS - a multi-tenanted SaaS warehouse management system. This API provides mutation endpoints for managing warehouse operations including inventory, goods in/out, users, and integrations.

**Note**: GET/list endpoints are not included as GraphQL is used for all data retrieval operations.

## Authentication

All endpoints require OAuth 2.0 Bearer token authentication. Obtain tokens from the auth server at `https://auth.clarus-api.com`.

## Multi-Tenancy

This is a multi-tenant system. Each tenant (subdomain) has isolated data. **You must include the `X-Clarus-Subdomain` header with every request** to specify which tenant you are operating on.

### Required Header

| Header | Required | Description |
|--------|----------|-------------|
| `X-Clarus-Subdomain` | Yes | The subdomain/tenant name identifying which tenant's data to access |

**Example:**
```
X-Clarus-Subdomain: acme-warehouse
```

## Request Format (JSON:API)

All mutation requests use JSON:API format. Data must be sent within a `data` object containing `type` and `attributes`:

```json
{
  "data": {
    "type": "resource_name",
    "attributes": {
      "field1": "value1"
    }
  }
}
```

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: Account/customer management endpoints for 3PL client management

tags.name: Charge Lines
tags.description: Charge line management endpoints for billing and invoicing operations

tags.description: Report query management endpoints for custom reporting and data extraction

tags.description: Warehouse management endpoints for multi-site operations

post.description: Create a new account (customer/client) for 3PL operations. Accounts are used to segregate inventory ownership.

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "data": {
    "type": "accounts",
    "attributes": {
      "code": "ACME",
      "name": "Acme Corporation",
      "email": "warehouse@acme.com",
      "is_active": true
    }
  }
}
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Required | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| `code` | Yes | Unique account code |
| `name` | Yes | Account display name |
| `email` | No | Primary contact email |
| `is_active` | No | Whether account is active (default: true) |

put.description: Update an existing account's attributes such as name, code, or operational settings.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the account to update

delete.description: Delete an account. Accounts with existing stock or orders cannot be deleted.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Cannot delete accounts with existing stock or orders
- Consider deactivating with `is_active: false` instead

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the account to delete

post.description: Create a new charge line to record a billable item. Charge lines are used for invoicing and billing operations.

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "data": {
    "type": "charge_lines",
    "attributes": {
      "charge_basket_id": 1,
      "code": "PICK-001",
      "name": "Picking Charge",
      "charge_type": "PICK",
      "quantity": 10,
      "price": 0.50,
      "goods_out_id": 123
    }
  }
}
```

## Required Fields

| Field | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `charge_basket_id` | Charge basket to add the line to |
| `code` | Unique code for the charge line (1-30 chars) |
| `name` | Display name for the charge (max 50 chars) |
| `charge_type` | One of: `PICK`, `RECEIPT`, `RENTAL`, `SUNDRY` |

## Optional Fields

| Field | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| `quantity` | Quantity to charge (defaults to 1.0) |
| `price` | Unit price (defaults to 0.0) |
| `description` | Additional description |
| `charge_price_id` | Reference to a charge price template |

## Charge Types & Recommended Associations

While all association fields are technically optional, each charge type has **recommended associations** based on what you're charging for:

### PICK - Picking/Outbound Charges
Charges for picking and packing operations.

| Field | Recommended | Purpose |
|-------|-------------|--------|
| `goods_out_id` | Yes | Link to the outbound order being charged |
| `goods_out_pick_list_id` | Optional | Link to specific pick list if applicable |
| `product_id` | Optional | Link to product if product-specific pricing |

```json
{
  "charge_type": "PICK",
  "goods_out_id": 123,
  "goods_out_pick_list_id": 456,
  "code": "PICK-001",
  "name": "Order Picking Fee",
  "quantity": 10,
  "price": 0.50
}
```

### RECEIPT - Receiving/Inbound Charges
Charges for receiving goods into the warehouse.

| Field | Recommended | Purpose |
|-------|-------------|--------|
| `inbound_good_id` | Yes | Link to the goods in receipt |
| `inbound_item_id` | Optional | Link to specific receipt line |
| `product_id` | Optional | Link to product if product-specific pricing |

```json
{
  "charge_type": "RECEIPT",
  "inbound_good_id": 789,
  "inbound_item_id": 101,
  "code": "RCV-001",
  "name": "Receiving Fee",
  "quantity": 50,
  "price": 0.25
}
```

### RENTAL - Storage Charges
Charges for storing goods in the warehouse.

| Field | Recommended | Purpose |
|-------|-------------|--------|
| `storage_unit_id` | Yes | Link to the storage unit being charged for |
| `product_id` | Optional | Link to product if product-specific rates |

```json
{
  "charge_type": "RENTAL",
  "storage_unit_id": 555,
  "code": "RENT-001",
  "name": "Weekly Pallet Storage",
  "quantity": 4,
  "price": 5.00
}
```

### SUNDRY - Miscellaneous Charges
Ad-hoc charges not tied to specific operations.

| Field | Recommended | Purpose |
|-------|-------------|--------|
| Any | Optional | Can link to any entity as needed |

```json
{
  "charge_type": "SUNDRY",
  "code": "ADMIN-001",
  "name": "Administrative Fee",
  "quantity": 1,
  "price": 25.00
}
```

## Important Notes

- **Total calculation**: The `total` field is automatically calculated as `quantity Ã— price`
- **Invoiced charges**: Once a charge line is invoiced (linked to an AR document), it cannot be modified or deleted
- **Warehouse access**: Users can only create/update charge lines for warehouses they have access to

delete.description: Delete multiple charge lines by providing a comma-separated list of IDs.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Pass IDs as comma-separated query parameter: `?ids=1,2,3`
- Invoiced charge lines cannot be deleted

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of charge line IDs to delete

put.description: Update an existing charge line's attributes.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the charge line to update

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Invoiced charge lines cannot be deleted

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the charge line to delete

post.description: Create a new goods in receipt (purchase order/ASN) to receive inventory into the warehouse. Include line items using the lines_changes array.

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "data": {
    "type": "goods_in_receipts",
    "attributes": {
      "account_id": 1,
      "warehouse_id": 1,
      "reference": "PO-2024-001",
      "expected_date_of_arrival": "2024-01-15T10:00:00Z",
      "supplier_id": 5,
      "lines_changes": [
        {
          "type": "ADD",
          "attributes": {
            "product_id": 123,
            "expected_quantity": 100,
            "batch_number": "BATCH-001",
            "expiry_date": "2025-01-15"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Required | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| `account_id` | Yes | Stock account ID (owner of incoming stock) |
| `warehouse_id` | Yes | Destination warehouse ID |
| `reference` | No | Your PO/ASN reference number |
| `expected_date_of_arrival` | No | Expected delivery date (ISO 8601) |
| `supplier_id` | No | Supplier/vendor ID |
| `lines_changes` | No | Array of line operations (ADD/UPDATE/REMOVE) |

## Line Item Operations

| Operation | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| `ADD` | Add a new line with `attributes` |
| `UPDATE` | Update existing line (requires `id`) |
| `REMOVE` | Remove line (requires `id`) |

put.description: Update an existing goods in receipt. Use lines_changes to add, update, or remove line items. Receipts that have started receiving may have restrictions on what can be changed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the goods in receipt to update

delete.description: Delete a goods in receipt. Receipts that have started receiving cannot be deleted.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Cannot delete receipts that have started receiving
- Only draft or pending receipts can be deleted

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the goods in receipt to delete

post.description: Queue goods out orders for asynchronous pick list generation. This is the preferred method for processing orders as it runs in the background without blocking. Each order gets its own pick list unless using the consolidation endpoint.

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "ids": [101, 102, 103]
}
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Required | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| `ids` | Yes | Array of goods out order IDs to process |

## Prerequisites

- Orders must be in PENDING or ALLOCATED status
- Account/warehouse permissions must allow pick processing

## Behavior

- Returns process_references for tracking pick list generation
- Each order gets its own pick list (use `/process_and_consolidate_picks` to merge)
- Orders are grouped by warehouse
- Crossdock orders are processed separately from sales orders
- Pick type can be `standard` (traditional picking) or `tote` (container-based batch picking)

## Tracking Status

Poll for completion via GraphQL:

```graphql
query {
  pickProcessingRequests(filter: { process_reference: { eq: "abc123def456" } }) {
    edges {
      node {
        id
        status
        process_reference
        message
        created_at
        updated_at
      }
    }
  }
}
```

Status values: `pending`, `completed`, `failed`

## Error Codes

| Code | Symbol | Description |
|------|--------|-------------|
| 36 | empty_ids_provided | No order IDs provided |
| 37 | invalid_ids_provided | Some IDs do not exist |
| 39 | not_enough_stocks_for_picking | Insufficient stock available |
| 59 | goods_out_already_allocated | Order already processed |

post.description: Process multiple goods out orders into a single consolidated pick list. All orders must have the same pick_type (standard or tote). Crossdock orders are always processed separately.

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "ids": [101, 102, 103],
  "goods_out_pick_list_attributes": {
    "goods_out_pick_list_reference": "BATCH-2024-001",
    "expected_date_of_dispatch": "2024-01-20T14:00:00Z",
    "goods_out_bay_id": 42
  }
}
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Required | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| `ids` | Yes | Array of goods out order IDs to consolidate |
| `goods_out_pick_list_attributes` | No | Optional attributes for the created pick list |
| `goods_out_pick_list_reference` | No | Custom reference for the consolidated pick list |
| `expected_date_of_dispatch` | No | Target dispatch date for the pick list |
| `goods_out_bay_id` | No | Staging location ID (must be location_type: GOBAY) |

## Prerequisites

- Orders must be in PENDING or ALLOCATED status
- All orders must have the same `pick_type` (standard or tote)

## Behavior

- Returns process_references for tracking pick list generation
- Merges multiple orders into a single consolidated pick list
- Crossdock orders are always processed separately (not consolidated)
- Sales orders and work orders can be consolidated together if same pick_type

## Tracking Status

Poll for completion via GraphQL:

```graphql
query {
  pickProcessingRequests(filter: { process_reference: { eq: "abc123def456" } }) {
    edges {
      node {
        id
        status
        process_reference
        message
      }
    }
  }
}
```

Status values: `pending`, `completed`, `failed`

## Error Codes

| Code | Symbol | Description |
|------|--------|-------------|
| 36 | empty_ids_provided | No order IDs provided |
| 37 | invalid_ids_provided | Some IDs do not exist |
| 39 | not_enough_stocks_for_picking | Insufficient stock available |
| 59 | goods_out_already_allocated | Order already processed |
| 318 | goods_outs_with_different_pick_types_cannot_be_consolidated | Mixed pick types in batch |

put.description: Update an existing pick list's attributes such as its reference.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the pick list to update

delete.description: Delete a pick list. This does not delete the associated goods out orders.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Does not delete associated goods out orders
- Pick lists in progress may not be deletable

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the pick list to delete

post.description: Process partially allocated orders by marking unallocated lines as short. Used when stock is insufficient and orders need to ship with available quantities.

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "ids": [101, 102, 103],
  "description": "Stock unavailable - shipping partial order",
  "reason_code_id": 5
}
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Required | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| `ids` | Yes | Array of goods out order IDs to short |
| `description` | Yes | Free text reason for shorting (audit trail) |
| `reason_code_id` | No | Reference to configurable ReasonCode lookup table |

## Prerequisites

- Account must have `is_short_pickable: true`
- Orders should be in PART_ALLOCATED status

## Behavior

- Marks unallocated order line quantities as short
- Allows orders to proceed with partial fulfillment
- Records reason in audit trail for compliance
- Can use reason_code_id for standardized reasons (configurable per tenant)

## Error Codes

| Code | Symbol | Description |
|------|--------|-------------|
| 36 | empty_ids_provided | No order IDs provided |
| 37 | invalid_ids_provided | Some IDs do not exist |

post.description: Create a new goods out order (sales order) for dispatching inventory from the warehouse.

x-codeSamples.label: JavaScript (fetch)
cURL

put.description: Update an existing goods out order. Use lines_changes to add, update, or remove line items. Orders that have started picking may have restrictions on what can be changed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the goods out order to update

delete.description: Delete a goods out order. Orders that have started processing cannot be deleted - use cancel instead.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Cannot delete orders that have started processing
- Use cancel endpoint instead for in-progress orders

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the goods out order to delete

post.description: Cancel a goods out order that is in progress. This will deallocate any allocated stock and cancel outstanding pick tasks.

x-mint.content:
## Cancellation Behavior

| Order Status | Result |
|--------------|--------|
| Draft/Pending | Order deleted |
| Allocated | Stock deallocated, order cancelled |
| Picking | Outstanding picks cancelled, stock deallocated |
| Completed | Cannot cancel - already dispatched |

**Note**: No request body required. The order ID in the path is sufficient.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the goods out order to cancel

post.summary: Add a product to a group
post.description: Create a product group association, linking a product to a group for categorization purposes.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the group to add the product to

group_id.description: The ID of the group (must match the path parameter)

product_id.description: The ID of the product to add to the group

delete.summary: Remove a product from a group
delete.description: Delete a product group association, removing a product from a group.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Removes product from group without deleting the product
- Pass `product_id` as query parameter

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the group

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: The ID of the product to remove from the group

post.description: Create a new third-party integration for connecting to ecommerce platforms, carriers, or ERP systems.

put.description: Update an existing integration's name, configuration, or active status.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the integration to update

delete.description: Delete an integration. This does not affect orders or data already imported from the integration.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Does not affect orders or data already imported
- Consider disabling instead to preserve mapping configuration

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the integration to delete

post.description: Trigger a manual synchronization of the integration to import orders, products, or stock levels from the connected system.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

Triggers a background synchronization job for the integration. The sync type depends on the integration configuration.

| Sync Type | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| Orders | Import new orders from the platform |
| Products | Sync product catalog changes |
| Stock | Push stock levels to the platform |

**Note**: No request body required. The integration ID in the path is sufficient.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the integration to synchronize

post.description: Create a new load to group shipments onto a vehicle for dispatch.

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "data": {
    "type": "loads",
    "attributes": {
      "reference": "LOAD-2024-001",
      "warehouse_id": 1,
      "carrier_id": 5,
      "trailer_id": 10,
      "expected_dispatch_date": "2024-01-20T14:00:00Z"
    }
  }
}
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Required | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| `reference` | No | Load reference number |
| `warehouse_id` | Yes | Warehouse ID |
| `carrier_id` | No | Carrier for transport |
| `trailer_id` | No | Trailer/vehicle ID |
| `expected_dispatch_date` | No | Planned dispatch date |

put.description: Update an existing load's attributes such as carrier, trailer, or dispatch date.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the load to update

delete.description: Delete a load. Loads that have been dispatched cannot be deleted.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Cannot delete loads that have been dispatched
- Removes associated shipments from the load

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the load to delete

post.description: Create a new storage location in the warehouse. Locations define where stock can be stored and picked from.

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "data": {
    "type": "locations",
    "attributes": {
      "code": "A-01-01-01",
      "warehouse_id": 1,
      "location_type_id": 1,
      "description": "Aisle A, Bay 01, Level 01, Position 01",
      "barcode": "LOC-A010101",
      "aisle": "A",
      "bay": "01",
      "level": "01",
      "position": "01"
    }
  }
}
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Required | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| `code` | Yes | Unique location code (max 60 chars) |
| `warehouse_id` | Yes | ID of the warehouse |
| `location_type_id` | Yes | Location type defining behavior |
| `barcode` | No | Scannable barcode for RF devices |
| `aisle`, `bay`, `level`, `position` | No | Physical location coordinates |

put.description: Update an existing location's attributes such as its code, description, or capacity settings.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the location to update

delete.description: Delete a storage location. Locations with existing stock cannot be deleted.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Cannot delete locations with existing stock
- Move stock out before deleting

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the location to delete

post.description: Create a new product in the warehouse catalog. Products are the master data for inventory items and define how stock is tracked, picked, and stored.

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "data": {
    "type": "products",
    "attributes": {
      "code": "SKU-001",
      "description": "Widget A - Standard Size",
      "stock_unit_type_id": 1,
      "barcode": "5012345678901",
      "commodity_code": "84719000",
      "country_of_manufacture": "GB",
      "shelf_life_min": 30,
      "shelf_life_max": 365
    }
  }
}
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Required | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| `code` | No | Unique product SKU code |
| `description` | Yes | Short product description |
| `stock_unit_type_id` | Yes | Unit of measure type ID |
| `barcode` | No | Primary product barcode |
| `commodity_code` | No | HS code for customs |
| `shelf_life_min` | No | Minimum shelf life in days |
| `shelf_life_max` | No | Maximum shelf life in days |

x-codeSamples.label: JavaScript (fetch)
cURL

delete.description: Delete multiple products from the warehouse catalog by providing a comma-separated list of IDs. Products with existing stock cannot be deleted.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Pass IDs as comma-separated query parameter: `?ids=1,2,3`
- Products with existing stock cannot be deleted

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of product IDs to delete

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "data": {
    "type": "products",
    "attributes": {
      "description": "Widget A - Large Size",
      "barcode": "5012345678902",
      "shelf_life_min": 60,
      "shelf_life_max": 730
    }
  }
}
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Required | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| `code` | No | Updated product SKU |
| `description` | No | Updated description |
| `barcode` | No | Updated barcode |
| `shelf_life_min/max` | No | Updated shelf life in days |

put.description: Update an existing product's attributes. Changes to product settings may affect how existing stock is managed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the product to update

delete.description: Delete a single product from the warehouse catalog. Products with existing stock cannot be deleted.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Products with existing stock cannot be deleted
- Consider deactivating instead to preserve history

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the product to delete

post.description: Trigger a replenishment process for a specific product at a location. Used to restock pick faces from bulk storage.

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "account_id": 1,
  "location_id": 42,
  "product_id": 123
}
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Required | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| `account_id` | Yes | Stock account ID |
| `location_id` | Yes | Pickface location ID to replenish |
| `product_id` | Yes | Product ID to replenish |

## Behavior

- Initiates replenishment from bulk storage to the specified pickface location
- Creates replenishment tasks for warehouse operators
- Used to maintain stock levels in picking areas

post.description: Create a new report query definition. Report queries allow you to save GraphQL queries for repeated execution.

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "data": {
    "type": "report_queries",
    "attributes": {
      "name": "Daily Stock Report",
      "description": "Shows current stock levels by product",
      "graphql": "query StockReport { stocks { nodes { id quantity product { code description } } } }",
      "parameters": [
        { "name": "warehouseId", "type": "ID" }
      ]
    }
  }
}
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Required | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| `name` | Yes | Report name for identification |
| `description` | No | Description of what the report shows |
| `graphql` | No | The GraphQL query to execute |
| `parameters` | No | Array of parameter definitions |

## Parameter Types

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| `ID` | Integer ID value |
| `String` | Text value |
| `Chronic` | Date/time parsed with natural language |

attributes.name: Daily Stock Report
attributes.description: Shows current stock levels by product
attributes.graphql: query StockReport { stocks { nodes { id quantity product { code description } } } }

put.description: Update an existing report query's definition.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the report query to update

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Scheduled reports using this query may need updating

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the report query to delete

post.description: Create a new role for user access control. Roles define a set of permissions that can be assigned to users.

put.description: Update an existing role's name, description, or permissions.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the role to update

delete.description: Delete a role. Roles that are assigned to users cannot be deleted.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Roles assigned to users cannot be deleted
- This action is permanent and cannot be undone

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the role to delete

post.description: Create a new shipment for a goods out order. Shipments contain package information and are submitted to carriers for label generation.

put.description: Update an existing shipment's attributes such as packages or address. Submitted shipments may have restrictions on what can be changed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the shipment to update

delete.description: Delete a shipment. Submitted shipments cannot be deleted - use cancel instead.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Submitted shipments cannot be deleted
- Use cancel endpoint for submitted shipments

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the shipment to delete

post.description: Submit a shipment to the carrier integration for label generation and tracking number assignment.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Submits shipment to configured carrier API
- Generates shipping label and tracking number
- Returns updated shipment with carrier response

## Prerequisites

- Shipment must have carrier_id assigned
- Carrier integration must be configured
- Packages must have valid dimensions

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the shipment to submit

post.description: Cancel a submitted shipment with the carrier. This will void any generated labels.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Cancels shipment with carrier API
- Voids any generated labels
- Returns updated shipment status

## Important

- Only submitted shipments can be cancelled
- Some carriers may not support cancellation after pickup

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the shipment to cancel

post.description: Place one or more stock records on hold, preventing them from being allocated to orders. Held stock remains at its location but is excluded from available inventory calculations.

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "ids": [123, 456],
  "description": "Quality check required",
  "reason_code_id": 1
}
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Required | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| `ids` | Yes | Array of stock IDs to place on hold |
| `description` | Yes | Reason for placing stock on hold |
| `reason_code_id` | No | Reason code ID for audit trail |

post.description: Release one or more stock records from hold, making them available for allocation to orders again.

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "ids": [123, 456],
  "description": "Quality check passed",
  "reason_code_id": 1
}
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Required | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| `ids` | Yes | Array of stock IDs to release from hold |
| `description` | Yes | Reason for releasing stock from hold |
| `reason_code_id` | No | Reason code ID for audit trail |

post.description: Move a quantity of stock from its current location to a different location within the same warehouse. Creates a transfer transaction for audit purposes.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the stock record to move

post.description: Transfer ownership of a quantity of stock from one account (customer) to another. The stock remains at the same location but changes ownership.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the stock record to transfer

post.description: Reduce the quantity of stock at a location. Use this for stock corrections, write-offs, or recording damaged/lost inventory.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the stock record to adjust

post.description: Create a new storage unit (pallet, cage, box, etc.) for grouping and tracking inventory as a single container.

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "data": {
    "type": "storage_units",
    "attributes": {
      "reference": "PLT-2024-001",
      "storage_unit_type_id": 1,
      "warehouse_id": 1,
      "location_id": 456,
      "barcode": "PLT2024001"
    }
  }
}
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Required | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| `reference` | No | Unique reference for the storage unit |
| `storage_unit_type_id` | Yes | Type of container (pallet, cage, etc.) |
| `warehouse_id` | Yes | Warehouse where unit is located |
| `location_id` | No | Current location ID |
| `barcode` | No | Scannable barcode for RF devices |

put.description: Update an existing storage unit's attributes such as its reference or location.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the storage unit to update

delete.description: Delete a storage unit. Storage units with associated stock cannot be deleted.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Cannot delete storage units with associated stock
- Remove stock before deleting

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the storage unit to delete

post.description: Create a new user account for accessing the WMS. Users are assigned roles that determine their permissions.

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "data": {
    "type": "users",
    "attributes": {
      "email": "john.smith@example.com",
      "name": "John Smith",
      "role_id": 5,
      "is_active": true
    }
  }
}
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Required | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| `email` | Yes | Unique email address for login |
| `name` | Yes | User display name |
| `role_id` | No | Role ID for permissions |
| `is_active` | No | Whether user can log in (default: true) |

put.description: Update an existing user's attributes such as name, email, role, or active status.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user to update

delete.description: Delete a user account. Consider deactivating instead to preserve audit history.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Consider setting `is_active: false` instead to preserve audit trail
- This action is permanent and cannot be undone

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user to delete

post.description: Create a new warehouse for multi-site operations. Each warehouse has its own locations and can operate independently.

x-mint.content:
## Request Structure

```json expandable
{
  "data": {
    "type": "warehouses",
    "attributes": {
      "code": "WH-NORTH",
      "name": "North Distribution Center",
      "address_1": "100 Industrial Park Way",
      "address_3": "Manchester",
      "postcode": "M1 1AA",
      "country_code": "GB"
    }
  }
}
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Required | Description |
|-------|----------|-------------|
| `code` | Yes | Unique warehouse code |
| `name` | Yes | Warehouse display name |
| `address_1` | No | Street address |
| `address_3` | No | Town/city (passed to carriers) |
| `country_code` | No | ISO country code |

put.description: Update an existing warehouse's attributes such as name, code, or address.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the warehouse to update

delete.description: Delete a warehouse. Warehouses with existing locations or stock cannot be deleted.

x-mint.content:
## Behavior

- Returns 204 No Content on success
- Cannot delete warehouses with existing locations or stock
- This action is permanent and cannot be undone

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the warehouse to delete

bearerAuth.description: OAuth 2.0 Bearer token. Obtain from https://auth.clarus-api.com

X-Clarus-Subdomain.name: X-Clarus-Subdomain
X-Clarus-Subdomain.description: The subdomain/tenant name identifying which tenant's data to access. This header is required for all API requests.

NoContent.description: Operation completed successfully with no content to return

Unauthorized.description: Authentication required - provide a valid Bearer token

NotFound.description: The requested resource was not found

UnprocessableEntity.description: Validation error or business logic error

code.description: Numeric error code for programmatic handling

source.description: Source of the error (service and method name)

AccountId.description: Stock account ID - the owner of the stock. Accounts represent 3PL clients or stock owners, not end customers.

WarehouseId.description: Warehouse ID - the physical warehouse location for operations

CustomerId.description: End customer ID - the recipient of the goods (distinct from account/stock owner)

ProductId.description: Product ID - reference to a product in the warehouse catalog

LocationId.description: Location ID - reference to a storage location within a warehouse

CarrierId.description: Carrier ID - reference to a shipping carrier (e.g., DHL, DPD, Royal Mail)

CarrierServiceId.description: Carrier service ID - reference to a specific carrier service level (e.g., Next Day, Express)

IntegrationId.description: Integration ID - reference to an external system integration (e.g., Shopify, Brightpearl)

GoodsOutStatusId.description: Goods out status ID. Default statuses: 1=DRAFT (order created but not ready), 2=PENDING (awaiting stock allocation), 3=PICK (picking in progress), 4=PART (legacy), 5=ALLOCATED (fully allocated), 6=COMPLETED (dispatched), 7=PART_ALLOCATED, 8=CANCELLED

OrderTypeId.description: Order type ID - configurable per tenant, used to categorize orders (e.g., for duty/tax purposes via duty_payable flag)

Reference.description: Reference number (e.g., order reference, receipt reference). Used for external system identification.

Priority.description: Priority level where lower numbers indicate higher priority (1 = highest)

DataResponse.description: Standard successful response wrapper following JSON:API format

Address.description: Physical address for delivery or collection

address_1.description: First line of address (street number and name)

address_3.description: Town/city - this field is typically passed to couriers as the city field

external_system_reference2.description: Secondary reference ID from external system

external_system_reference3.description: Tertiary reference ID from external system

ConsolidatedPickRequest.description: Request body for consolidated pick processing

ids.description: Array of goods out order IDs to consolidate into a single pick list

goods_out_pick_list_attributes.description: Optional attributes for the created pick list

goods_out_pick_list_reference.description: Custom reference for the consolidated pick list

expected_date_of_dispatch.description: Target dispatch date for the pick list

goods_out_bay_id.description: Staging location ID where picks will be sent. Must be a location with location_type: GOBAY

GoodsOutType.description: Type of goods out order. 'sales_order' for standard sales fulfillment, 'work_order' for internal transfers/kitting, 'crossdock' for direct transfers bypassing storage.

PickProcessingRequest.description: Request body for asynchronous pick processing

ids.description: Array of goods out order IDs to process

PickProcessingResponse.description: Response containing process references for tracking pick processing status

process_references.description: Array of process reference strings for tracking the queued pick processing jobs via GraphQL

PickType.description: Pick type determines the picking method. 'standard' for traditional single-order picking, 'tote' for container-based batch picking where multiple orders are picked simultaneously into totes.

ProcessReference.description: Unique reference for a pick processing batch. Generated automatically if not provided. Used to track and correlate pick lists created from the same processing request.

ShortOrderLinesRequest.description: Request body for shorting partially allocated order lines

ids.description: Array of goods out order IDs to short

description.description: Free text reason for shorting the order lines. Used for audit trail - content is determined by the user.

reason_code_id.description: Optional reference to a configurable ReasonCode lookup table for standardized reasons

TriggerReplenishmentRequest.description: Request body for triggering pickface replenishment

ProductAttributes.description: Product attributes for creating or updating products

description.description: Short product description displayed in lists

stock_unit_type_id.description: ID of the stock unit type (defines measurement unit)

commodity_code.description: Harmonized System (HS) commodity code for customs

country_of_manufacture.description: ISO country code of manufacture origin

shelf_life_min.description: Minimum acceptable shelf life in days at receipt

shelf_life_max.description: Maximum shelf life in days from manufacture

stop.description: If true, product is stopped from all operations

output_quantity.description: Output quantity for bill of materials assembly

assemble_on_pick.description: If true, assemble components during picking

require_dimensions_on_receipt.description: If true, require dimension capture at goods in

pick_strategy.description: How orders for this product should be picked

product_type.description: Whether product is single item or assembly

unit_quantity_conversion_strategy.description: How to convert between quantity and unit measurement

default_order_configuration.description: Default packaging level for outbound orders

default_receipt_configuration.description: Default packaging level for inbound receipts

external_system_reference1.description: Reference ID from external system (e.g., ERP product ID)

StockHoldRequest.description: Request body for placing stocks on hold

ids.description: Array of stock IDs to place on hold

description.description: Reason for placing stock on hold

reason_code_id.description: Reason code ID for audit trail

StockOffholdRequest.description: Request body for removing stocks from hold

ids.description: Array of stock IDs to release from hold

description.description: Reason for releasing stock from hold

reason_code_id.description: Reason code ID for audit trail

StockMoveRequest.description: Request body for moving stock to another location

reason_code_id.description: Reason code ID for the move

StockTransferRequest.description: Request body for transferring stock to another account

reason_code_id.description: Reason code ID for the transfer

StockNegativeAdjustmentRequest.description: Request body for negative stock adjustment

reason_code_id.description: Reason code ID for the adjustment

LocationAttributes.description: Location attributes for creating or updating warehouse locations

code.description: Unique location code within the warehouse

warehouse_id.description: ID of the warehouse this location belongs to

location_type_id.description: ID of the location type (defines behavior)

is_pickface.description: If true, this is a forward pick location

storage_unit_type_id.description: ID of the storage unit type (pallet, cage, box, etc.)

GoodsInReceiptLineChange.description: Line item change for goods in receipts (ADD, UPDATE, or DESTROY)

id.description: Line ID (required for UPDATE and DESTROY)

attributes.description: Line attributes (required for ADD, optional for UPDATE)

alt_line_note.description: Alternative line note from source system

alt_line_number.description: Alternative line number from source system

alt_line_reference.description: Alternative line reference from source system

alt_product_code.description: Alternative product code from source system

account_id.description: Stock account ID - the owner of the incoming stock

warehouse_id.description: Warehouse ID where stock will be received

reference.description: Purchase order or ASN reference number

lines_changes.description: Array of line item changes (ADD, UPDATE, DESTROY)

GoodsOutLineChange.description: Line item change for goods out orders (ADD, UPDATE, or DESTROY)

attributes.description: Line attributes (required for ADD, optional for UPDATE)

alt_line_note.description: Alternative line note from source system

alt_line_number.description: Alternative line number from source system

alt_line_reference.description: Alternative line reference from source system

alt_product_code.description: Alternative product code from source system

datetime1.description: Custom datetime field 1 (e.g., expiry date filter)

dispatch_strategy.description: How this line should be dispatched

goods_in_receipt_line_id.description: Link to specific inbound receipt line

stock_to_pick_id.description: Specific stock record to pick from

storage_unit_reference.description: Specific storage unit to pick from

id.description: Line ID (required for UPDATE and DESTROY)

delivery_notes.example: Leave at reception if no answer

expected_date_of_dispatch.description: Target dispatch date and time in ISO 8601 format

lines_changes.description: Array of line item changes (ADD, UPDATE, DESTROY)

goods_out_ids.description: Array of goods out IDs to include

packages.description: Array of packages in this shipment

is_active.description: If false, user cannot log in

tote_dispatch_strategy.description: Default dispatch strategy for tote picks

account_id.description: Default account ID for imported orders

warehouse_id.description: Default warehouse ID for imported orders

ChargeLineCreateAttributes.description: Attributes for creating a charge line. Different charge types have recommended associations - see the endpoint documentation for details.

charge_basket_id.description: The charge basket this line belongs to. Each charge basket groups related charges for billing.

charge_price_id.description: Reference to a charge price template. When provided, copies default pricing from the template.

charge_type.description: Type of charge. PICK for outbound/picking, RECEIPT for inbound/receiving, RENTAL for storage, SUNDRY for miscellaneous.

code.description: Unique code identifying this charge line (e.g., 'PICK-001', 'RENT-WK01').

description.description: Additional description or notes about this charge.

goods_out_id.description: Associated goods out order. Recommended for PICK charges to link the charge to the outbound order.

goods_out_pick_list_id.description: Associated pick list. Optional for PICK charges when charging per pick list.

inbound_good_id.description: Associated goods in receipt. Recommended for RECEIPT charges to link the charge to the inbound receipt.

inbound_item_id.description: Associated goods in receipt line. Optional for RECEIPT charges when charging per line item.

name.description: Display name for the charge (e.g., 'Order Picking Fee', 'Weekly Pallet Storage').

price.description: Unit price for this charge. Total is calculated as quantity Ã— price.

product_id.description: Associated product. Optional for any charge type when using product-specific pricing.

quantity.description: Quantity for this charge (e.g., number of items picked, pallets stored).

storage_unit_id.description: Associated storage unit. Recommended for RENTAL charges to link the charge to the stored container.

ChargeLineUpdateAttributes.description: Attributes for updating a charge line. All fields are optional - only include fields you want to change. Invoiced charge lines cannot be updated.

charge_basket_id.description: Move the charge line to a different charge basket.

charge_price_id.description: Reference to a charge price template.

charge_type.description: Type of charge. Changing this may require updating associations.

code.description: Unique code identifying this charge line.

description.description: Additional description or notes about this charge.

goods_out_id.description: Associated goods out order. Recommended for PICK charges.

goods_out_pick_list_id.description: Associated pick list. Optional for PICK charges.

inbound_good_id.description: Associated goods in receipt. Recommended for RECEIPT charges.

inbound_item_id.description: Associated goods in receipt line. Optional for RECEIPT charges.

price.description: Unit price for this charge. Total is recalculated on save.

quantity.description: Quantity for this charge. Total is recalculated on save.

storage_unit_id.description: Associated storage unit. Recommended for RENTAL charges.

code.description: Unique code for this charge line

name.description: Name of the report query for identification

description.description: Description of what the report query does

graphql.description: The GraphQL query to execute when running this report

parameters.description: Array of parameter definitions for the query

example.name: Daily Stock Report
example.description: Shows current stock levels by product
example.graphql: query StockReport { stocks { nodes { id quantity product { code description } } } }
